article:
'Tyrosine-protein kinase Lyn' is a protein that in humans is encoded in humans
by the LYN gene.

Lyn is a member of the Src family of protein tyrosine kinases, which is mainly
expressed in hematopoietic cells, in neural tissues liver,
and adipose tissue. In various hematopoietic cells, Lyn has emerged
as a key enzyme involved in the regulation of cell activation. In these cells, a
small amount of LYN is associated with cell surface receptor proteins, including
the B cell antigen receptor (BCR), CD40, or
CD19. Campbell 1999
